intro: Harpachne harpachnoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved harpachne, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, or grass family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences, which contain both male and female flowers. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Harpachne harpachnoides is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
